title: Guy Mannering
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Ye see we march on the tap o' Touthop Riggafter we pass the Pomoragrains; for the Pomoragrains, andSlackenspool, and Bloodylaws, they come in there, and they belangto the Peel; but after ye pass Pomoragrains at a muckle greatsaucer-headed cutlugged stane, that they ca' Charlie's Chuckie,there Dawston Cleugh and Charlies-hope they march.

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: The ancestor himself was John Rutherford of Grundisnock, which is an appanage of the Hunthill estate, and he was married to Isabel Ker of Bloodylaws.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
